message.content: Now let me examine the current pod file to see what needs to be fixed based on the review comments.

content:
Here's the result of running `cat -n` on /workspace/SheepVibes/pod/sheepvibespod.pod:
     1	# Podman Quadlet for the SheepVibes Pod
     2	
     3	################################################################################
     4	# [Unit] Section
     5	# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
     6	# This section provides metadata about the systemd unit.
     7	################################################################################
     8	
     9	[Unit]
    10	Description=SheepVibes Application Pod
    11	Requires=network-online.target
    12	After=network-online.target
    13	
    14	
    15	################################################################################
    16	# [Pod] Section
    17	# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    18	# This section defines the pod, which is a group of containers that share
    19	# resources, such as the network namespace.
    20	################################################################################
    21	
    22	[Pod]
    23	# Publishes a port from the pod to the host.
    24	# Format: IP:HOST_PORT:CONTAINER_PORT
    25	PublishPort=127.0.0.1:5000:5000
    26	
    27	
    28	################################################################################
    29	# [Volume] Sections
    30	# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    31	# These sections define the persistent storage volumes used by the containers.
    32	################################################################################
    33	
    34	[Volume/sheepvibes-db]
    35	# Defines a volume for the application's database.
    36	# systemd will create a volume named 'sheepvibespod-sheepvibes-db'.
    37	
    38	[Volume/sheepvibes-redis]
    39	# Defines a volume for the Redis cache data.
    40	# systemd will create a volume named 'sheepvibespod-sheepvibes-redis'.
    41	
    42	
    43	################################################################################
    44	# [Container] Sections
    45	# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    46	# These sections define the individual containers that will run within the pod.
    47	################################################################################
    48	
    49	# --- Application Container ---
    50	[Container/app]
    51	# Specifies that this container belongs to the defined pod.
    52	Pod=sheepvibespod.pod
    53	
    54	# Sets a custom name for the container.
    55	ContainerName=sheepvibes-app
    56	
    57	# The container image to use.
    58	Image=ghcr.io/sheepdestroyer/sheepvibes:latest
    59	
    60	# Mounts the 'sheepvibes-db' volume into the container at '/app/data'.
    61	Volume=sheepvibes-db.volume:/app/data
    62	
    63	# --- Environment Variables for the Application ---
    64	Environment=DATABASE_PATH=/app/data/sheepvibes.db
    65	Environment=CACHE_REDIS_URL=redis://localhost:6379/0
    66	Environment=FLASK_APP=backend.app
    67	Environment=PYTHONPATH=/app
    68	Environment=UPDATE_INTERVAL_MINUTES=15
    69	Environment=FLASK_RUN_HOST=0.0.0.0
    70	
    71	# --- Service Options for the Application Container ---
    72	# Automatically restart the container if it fails.
    73	Restart=on-failure
    74	
    75	# Increases the startup timeout to allow for image pulls or slow initialization.
    76	TimeoutStartSec=180
    77	
    78	
    79	# --- Redis Container ---
    80	[Container/redis]
    81	# Specifies that this container belongs to the defined pod.
    82	Pod=sheepvibespod.pod
    83	
    84	# Sets a custom name for the container.
    85	ContainerName=sheepvibes-redis
    86	
    87	# The container image to use.
    88	Image=docker.io/redis:alpine
    89	
    90	# Mounts the 'sheepvibes-redis' volume into the container at '/data'.
    91	Volume=sheepvibes-redis.volume:/data
    92	
    93	# --- Service Options for the Redis Container ---
    94	# Automatically restart the container if it fails.
    95	Restart=on-failure
    96	
    97	# Sets the startup timeout.
    98	TimeoutStartSec=90
    99	
   100	
   101	################################################################################
   102	# [Install] Section
   103	# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
   104	# This section defines the target to which this unit should be linked when
   105	# it is enabled with 'systemctl enable'.
   106	################################################################################
   107	
   108	[Install]
   109	# Ensures this pod is started at boot when the default target is reached.
   110	WantedBy=default.target
   111
